sentences.english: There was no longer any possibility of suggesting limitations or of countenancing rebellion.
sentences.chinese: 已不允許再有任何對君權的限制或反抗。

sentences.english: The origin of the cabinet system of Ming Dynasty could be traced back to the conflicting process between the premier power and the monarchic power.
sentences.chinese: 明代內閣制的緣起可追溯至相權與君權的鬥爭過程。

sentences.english: In ancient China, monarchical power transfer was directly related to the late monarch's obsequies.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代的君權交替過程與故君的喪禮有直接關係。

sentences.english: The power of emperor's guard troopswastheorganic constitute of Chinese ancient regality.
sentences.chinese: 禁衛軍權是中國古代專制君權的有機構成。

sentences.english: The power of emperor's guard troops was the organic constitute of Chinese ancient autarchical regality .
sentences.chinese: 禁衛軍權是中國古代專制君權的有機構成。

sentences.english: People used to believe in the divine right of kings.
sentences.chinese: 過去人們相信君權神授。

sentences.english: The astronomical calendar symbolized the "mandate of Heaven" for the ruler.
sentences.chinese: 曆法是“君權神授”的“天命”的象徵。

definition: running of armed forces/military management/to govern armed forces/to direct troops
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another

three principles and five virtues (idiom)/the three rules (ruler guides subject, father guides son and husband guides wife) and five constant virtues of Confucianism (benevolence 仁, righteousness 義|义, propriety 禮|礼, wisdom 智 and fidelity 信)
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
